The meeting with VanDuyn and Masters was entirely
pleasant and satisfactory* They were definitely of the
opinion that we were tying the Executive Director down
too much, and I frankly pointed out that it had been
necessary for the good of the organization to spell out
in great detail the plan of operation which we expected
from him, I asked VanDuya for a specific statement of
the relation which he felt should be maintained between the
E. D* and the Board, and his statement followed very closely

I believe are in complete agreement and there is certainly

I had a lengthy conference with Bob Saturday afternoon
after everyone else had left, and I have a better feeling
about our relations with the FAE. I gathered that the
$50,000.00 grant was one that they were watching with con¬
siderable interest and hope and that they were in no wise
prejudiced against considering requests from us at a later
date* He seemed to be receptive to the idea that the
Foundation committee should be a creature of the Board
and that funds could be handled by the Board rather than
by committees selected by the FAE* Incidentally, Jim
